translated: It is to protect and be mindful of sentient beings. It is to be without malice. It is to protect and not to violate pure discipline. It is to have a very even mind. It is to be without deceit. It is to be without miserliness.

original: phrag dog med pa dang / 'dod chags kyi bsam pa med pa dang / slu ba'i bsam pa med pa dang / theg pa chen po'i mdo sde dam pa dag la mngon par yid ches pa dang / dbang phyug dang / rgyags pa la zhen cing sred pa med pa dang /

translated: It is to be without envy. It is to be without thoughts of desire. It is to be without thoughts of deception. It is to have conviction in the sacred scriptures of the Great Vehicle. It is to have no craving or desire for power and intoxication.

original: bzod pa'i stobs phun sum tshogs pa dang / smon lam las phyir mi ldog pa dang / bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag par gyur pa dang / dgon pa na gnas pa dang / 'khor rnams la mi brten pa dang / rnyed pa la mi brten pa dang /

translated: It is to have perfect patience. It is to be irreversible from one‚Äôs aspirations. It is to have a very pure intention. It is to live in solitude. It is to not rely on one‚Äôs retinue. It is to not rely on gain.

original: grags pa la mi brten pa dang / bsam gtan rnams la rab tu gnas pa dang / 'od zer gyi ting nge 'dzin rab tu ston pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dag la sgyu med par rim gro byed pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag la mchog gi bsam pa bskyed pa dang /

translated: generating the highest intention toward those who practice pure conduct,üîΩand being very respectful toward preceptors and masters out of reverence for the Dharma.üîΩIt is to have a thorough realization of the meaning of the s≈´tras,üîΩto be skilled in teaching correctly,

translated: It is to know the various things. It is to know the spiritual friends. It is to be dedicated to the Great Vehicle. It is to don the armor of diligence. It is to tame beings through one‚Äôs conduct.

translated: It is to cut through the doubts of those who have fallen into afflictions. It is to criticize nonvirtue and to accomplish virtuous qualities. It is to not associate with nonvirtuous companions. It is to be indefatigable in producing roots of virtue.

translated: It is to develop the mind of awakening. It is to apply diligence. It is to realize the nature of the mƒÅras. It is to actualize the truths. It is to make offerings in the correct way. It is to cut through doubts.

translated: It is to always think of bringing sentient beings to complete nirvƒÅ·πáa. It is to have no attachment to existence. It is to generate a vast mind. It is to teach sentient beings about the many problems of nonvirtue.

translated: It is to eliminate desire, anger, and ignorance. It is to not seek the benefits of desire. It is to ripen sentient beings. It is to repair st≈´pas of the thus-gone ones. It is to generate respect for the noble ones.

translated: It is to rely on and serve those who abide in the Great Vehicle. It is to not praise those of the Lesser Vehicle. It is to distance oneself from those of the ≈örƒÅvakayƒÅna. It is to defeat opponents.

translated: They make vast offerings to the blessed buddhas and offer them with a particularly noble attitude. translated: They spread the Dharma far and wide, are never satisfied with guiding others, perfect their conduct, and possess great splendor.

analyzed: spobs pa thogs pa med pa dang / mang du thos pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi bsngags pa mi brjod pa dang / dge ba'i las yang dag par sgrub pa dang / phung po rnams khong du chud pa dang /
translated: It is to have unimpeded eloquence, to be replete with abundant learning, to not praise nonvirtue, to accomplish virtuous actions, to comprehend the aggregates,

analyzed: lta ba rnams rab tu spangs pa dang / rgyu'i ngo bo nyid rab tu rtogs pa dang / spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa dang / spyod yul ma yin pa yongs su spangs pa dang / yongs su dang pa bskyed pa dang / yang dag pa'i lam la gnas pa dang /
translated: to abandon views, to realize the nature of causes, to transcend the domain, to abandon the nondomain, to generate complete purity, to abide on the true path,

original: theg pa chen po la rab tu dga' ba dang / mnyam pa nyid du yongs su sdud par byed pa dang / bdag med pa la mngon par ma chags pa dang / 'khor ba la yongs su skyo ba med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su tshol ba la mos pa dang /

translated: to delight in the Great Vehicle, to gather through sameness, to not be attached to selflessness, to not be weary of sa·πÉsƒÅra, to be dedicated to seeking nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: 'dod pa chung ba'i phyir dgon pa na gnas pa dang / rtag tu bsod snyoms slong zhing le lo med par gyur pa dang / ji tsam rnyed pa de nyid kyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa spangs pa dang /

translated: It is to live in the wilderness because of having few desires. It is to be without laziness while constantly begging for alms. It is to be satisfied with whatever is obtained. It is to abandon shamelessness and a lack of embarrassment.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen par byed pa dang / dge ba'i grogs po dang lhan cig gnas pa dang / bdag gi zla ma yin pa rnams rab tu spong ba dang / so so'i skye bo rnams la snying brtse ba dang / sems can gyi spyod pa dang mthun par byed pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen par byed pa dang / dge ba'i grogs po dang lhan cig gnas pa dang / bdag gi zla ma yin pa rnams rab tu spong ba dang / so so'i skye bo rnams la snying brtse ba dang / sems can gyi spyod pa dang mthun par byed pa dang /
translated: It is to serve the buddhas. It is to live with virtuous companions. It is to abandon those who are not one‚Äôs equal. It is to have compassion for ordinary beings. It is to be in harmony with the conduct of beings.

original: sangs rgyas la shin tu dang ba dang / snod ma yin @348b pa yongs su spong ba dang / mi mthun pa rnams la tshig sbyin par mi byed pa dang / gsol ba mi 'debs pa dag la yang dag par ston par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la shin tu dang ba dang / snod ma yin @348b pa yongs su spong ba dang / mi mthun pa rnams la tshig sbyin par mi byed pa dang / gsol ba mi 'debs pa dag la yang dag par ston par mi byed pa dang /
translated: It is to have great faith in the Buddha. It is to abandon those who are not suitable vessels. It is to not give teachings to those who are unsuitable. It is to not give teachings to those who do not request it.

original: gsol ba 'debs pa zhig 'ongs na ci rigs par ston par byed pa dang / zas la snyoms par gyur pa dang / rtag tu gtong zhing mnyam pa nyid du gtong ba dang / sgo chen po phye nas gtong bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa zhig 'ongs na ci rigs par ston par byed pa dang / zas la snyoms par gyur pa dang / rtag tu gtong zhing mnyam pa nyid du gtong ba dang / sgo chen po phye nas gtong bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: If someone comes to request something, he teaches them whatever is appropriate. He is impartial with regard to food. He always gives and gives equally. He gives after opening the great door.

original: gzhon nu / chos rnam pa brgyad cu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu / chos rnam pa brgyad cu zhes bya ste /
translated: Prince, these are called the eighty dharmas.

translated: By these, the TathƒÅgatas attain unobstructed liberation.

original: de'i tshe zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa chos de lta bu thos pas rab tu dga' bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyar sngar tshigs su bcad de mngon par bstod pa /

translated: At that time, Prince Candraprabha, having heard such dharmas, became overjoyed and praised the BhagavƒÅn with these verses in front of the assembly:
